item.title: Val add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Val add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Val add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Val add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Val add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Val add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Val add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Val add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Val add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Val add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Val add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Val add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Val add a quote by Kiana Davenport
item.description: "She was kahuna, creating more life around her than was actually there, heightening the momentousness of each living thing by simply gazing upon it." -- Kiana Davenport

item.title: Val add a quote by Tony Kushner
item.description: "In this world, there is a kind of painful progress. Longing for what we've left behind, and dreaming ahead." -- Tony Kushner

item.title: Val add a quote by Louis Menand
item.description: "Quotable quotes are coins rubbed smooth by circulation." -- Louis Menand

item.title: Val add a quote by Colette
item.description: "I went to collect the few personal belongings which...I held to be invaluable: my cat, my resolve to travel, and my solitude." -- Colette

item.title: Val add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty." -- Jonathan Safran Foer
